cn.crowdos.kernel.algorithms

Class T_Most

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.crowdos.kernel.algorithms.T_Most

  • public class T_Most
extends Object
    Author:
    wushengjie T_Most is a class that implements a greedy algorithm for task assignment. It assigns tasks to workers based on the closest worker to each task, starting with the task that needs the largest number of workers. The algorithm continues until all tasks have been assigned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • T_Most

        public T_Most(int workerNum,
              int taskNum,
              double[][] distanceMatrix,
              double[][] taskDistanceMatrix,
              int[] p,
              int q)
        Parameters:
        workerNum - Number of workers
        taskNum - Number of tasks
        distanceMatrix - Worker task distance matrix, which stores the distance between a worker and a task (or the cost of a task for a worker)
        taskDistanceMatrix - Task distance matrix, which holds the distance between tasks and tasks
        p - Constraints, how many workers are needed for each task
        q - Constraints, how many tasks are assigned to each worker at most

    • Method Detail

      • taskAssign

        public void taskAssign()
        Assign tasks to workers using a greedy algorithm. This method assigns tasks to workers based on the closest worker to each task, starting with the task that needs the largest number of workers. The algorithm continues until all tasks have been assigned.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of tasks is less than or equal to zero, or the number of workers is less than or equal to zero.

      • sortMap

        public Map<Integer,Double> sortMap(Map<Integer,Double> map)
        1、Converts the entrySet of the Map to a List 2、sort with the sort method of the Collections utility class 3、Iterate over the sorted list and put each set of keys and values into a LinkedHashMap(the only Map implementation class that stores the values in order of insertion is LinkedHashMap).
        Parameters:
        map - the map to be sorted
        Returns:
        a LinkedHashMap containing the sorted entries

      • isAssignWorker

        public boolean isAssignWorker(int workerIndex)
        Check if the worker is already assigned with q number of tasks. If the worker is assigned with q number of tasks, set the distance between this worker and all tasks to INF (infinite).
        Parameters:
        workerIndex - the index of the worker to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the worker is already assigned with q number of tasks, false otherwise

      • isAssignTask

        public boolean isAssignTask(int taskIndex)
        Checks whether the given task has been assigned to enough workers based on its required number of workers. If so, updates the distance matrix by setting the distance to INF for all workers to that task.
        Parameters:
        taskIndex - The index of the task to check.
        Returns:
        True if the task has been assigned to enough workers, false otherwise.

      • countTaskIndex

        public int countTaskIndex(int taskIndex)
        Counts the number of workers that have been assigned a particular task.
        Parameters:
        taskIndex - The index of the task to count the number of workers for.
        Returns:
        The number of workers that have been assigned the specified task.

      • isTaskAssignFinish

        public boolean isTaskAssignFinish()
        Checks whether all tasks have been assigned to the required number of workers or not.
        Returns:
        true if all tasks have been assigned to the required number of workers, false otherwise.
